oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Shahsevan: nomads of Iran
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Shahsevan (Iranian people) -- Social life and customs.
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Color, 28 min, late 1970s. Made by the Iranian anthropologist, Fereydoun Sartzadeh, and Arlene Dallalfar, a sociologist, among the Shahsevan, a group of pastoral nomads in the Azerbaijan area of Iran. The focus is on the annual cycle of movement, gender differences and relations, relations with the state and urban life, material culture.
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Dallalfar, Arlene; Safizadeh, Fereydoun
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Ethnographic and Anthropological Films - Egypt and Beyond
